definition: to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The season's in full swing now.
sentences.chinese: 现在球季正打得火热呢。

sentences.english: Lee goes down well with the carrier bag people.
sentences.chinese: 李与购物袋公司的人打得火热。

sentences.english: Are you blind, I'm making out with a 12, I am winning.
sentences.chinese: 你没看到我正和一个12分的打得火热，我赢回来了。

sentences.english: He's taken up with a divorced woman, I understand.
sentences.chinese: 我想他正和一个离婚的女人打得火热。

sentences.english: We see the union leaders cheek by jowl with the capitalists.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到工会领导人和资本家们打得火热。

sentences.english: My friend was rapt with this young lady he’d met.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友和一个他认识的女孩正打得火热。

arch-enemy/sworn enemy

to have a falling out/to have a big argument
